scenarios.name: The goal is to understand what you’d need from a potential app so we can shape the requirements
given: a user is using the product
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: The goal is to understand what you’d need from a potential app so we can shape the requirements.

scenarios.name: The dashboard should include an indicator when a project is behind schedule
given: a user is using the product
when: the user include an indicator when a project is behind schedule
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): The dashboard should include an indicator when a project is behind schedule.

scenarios.name: Team members need to update their tasks directly in the app
given: a user is using the product
when: the user update their tasks directly in the app
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): Team members need to update their tasks directly in the app.

scenarios.name: If someone has an overdue task or an upcoming deadline, the app should remind them automatically
given: a user is using the product
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): If someone has an overdue task or an upcoming deadline, the app should remind them automatically.

scenarios.name: Project managers need full visibility across all projects
given: a user is using the product
when: the user Project managers need full visibility across all projects
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): Project managers need full visibility across all projects.

scenarios.name: Contributors only see assigned tasks
given: an individual contributor has an assigned task and an unassigned task exists
when: the contributor views their task list

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): Individual contributors should only see the tasks they’re assigned to.

scenarios.name: Executives can view progress but cannot edit
given: an executive is viewing project progress
when: the executive attempts to edit a project status

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): Executives should be able to view progress, but not edit anything.

scenarios.name: We need to export project summaries to PDF or Excel
given: a user is using the product
when: the user export project summaries to PDF or Excel
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): We need to export project summaries to PDF or Excel.

scenarios.name: Project deadlines should sync to our calendars automatically
given: a user is using the product
when: the user sync to our calendars automatically
then: the system allows the action and produces an observable result

evidence.quote: Alex (Customer): Project deadlines should sync to our calendars automatically.

scenarios.name: Audit log entry is recorded for internal note changes
given: a support agent is using the product
when: the support agent adds or edits an internal note
then: an audit log entry is recorded

evidence.quote: Jordan (Product Owner): We must record an audit log entry whenever a task is updated or an internal note is added.

followUpQuestions: What are the preconditions/data setup for each scenario?
What are the success criteria and error cases?
Which scenarios are highest priority for automation?
